CONCLUSION: Violation of Art. 6-1;Pecuniary damage - claim dismissed;Non-pecuniary damage - financial award;Costs and expenses award - Convention proceedings
TEXT: CARDINAL . ORG The applicant , who is a NORP citizen born in DATE , has a doctorate in law and lives in GPE . He was struck off the Bar roll of that city and has twice applied unsuccessfully to be reinstated .
CARDINAL . ORG In DATE , after completing the prescribed period as a pupil avocat in GPE , H was entered on the roll and took chambers .
CARDINAL . ORG In DATE , ORG of GPE commenced disciplinary action against him for having deliberately given false information to clients .

On DATE , it struck him off the roll , having satisfied itself that he had wrongly persuaded a client that he ( the client ) risked arrest if he did not immediately pay a sum of CARDINAL BF . The ORG had previously dismissed the other charges against H.
On appeal by H , ORG , in a judgment on DATE , affirmed the decision to strike him off ; and on DATE , ORG dismissed H ’s appeal on points of law .

CARDINAL . H was subsequently prosecuted for fraud and unlawfully holding himself out as an avocat ; he was in custody pending trial from DATE to CARDINAL DATE and many of his files were seized . He was acquitted by ORG on DATE and made an unsuccessful claim for compensation .
CARDINAL . ORG In DATE , the applicant set up as a legal and tax adviser , after having worked for some time as a commercial traveller .

CARDINAL . On DATE , when he was about to apply to have his name restored to the roll , the police again seized documents at his office . On DATE , the chambre du conseil of ORG committed him for trial in ORG for forgery and fraudulent conversion , but the prosecution ended in an acquittal on DATE .
CARDINAL . H has no criminal convictions .
CARDINAL . ORG By a letter of DATE , the applicant requested ORG of GPE to restore his name to the roll . This application was based on LAW ( see paragraph CARDINAL below ) .
CARDINAL . ORG On DATE , at a sitting of the ORG , the bâtonnier ( leader ) of the Antwerp Bar appointed a rapporteur .
After deliberating on CARDINAL and DATE , the ORG decided to hear the applicant and his counsel .

CARDINAL . ORG The hearing was held on DATE . According to H ’s counsel , the " exceptional circumstances " justifying his restoration to the roll consisted essentially in the great professional and family difficulties his client had experienced over DATE , particularly as he had to confine himself to his occupation as a legal and tax adviser ; furthermore his disbarment had not been followed up with any criminal proceedings and the later prosecutions had ended in acquittals .

CARDINAL . The Council of the ORG dismissed the application on DATE ; although DATE had elapsed since H had been struck off , the explanations offered orally by H ’s counsel did not disclose any exceptional circumstances such as would justify restoring his name to the roll .

CARDINAL . ORG On DATE , the applicant renewed his application . He appended a memorandum criticising the DATE decision and to which was attached an opinion by a retired procureur général ( Principal Crown Prosecutor ) , B. According to B , ORG should , under LAW , have reported to the GPE procureur du PERSON ( ORG ) the matters of which the applicant stood accused ; that would have entailed suspending the disciplinary proceedings until the final decision in the criminal trial was known .

CARDINAL . The Council of the Ordre heard H and his counsel on DATE . Counsel submitted that the decision to disbar H had been based on the uncorroborated evidence of CARDINAL of H ’s clients , and that from DATE to DATE H had run his legal and tax consultancy very satisfactorily . He added that in DATE ORG had not reported the facts to the procureur du Roi , with the result that no prosecution had been brought and H had not had a chance of securing an acquittal . He also emphasised H ’s family difficulties . In addition , he filed a memorandum in which the applicant explained why the retired procureur général B was entitled to give an opinion .

CARDINAL . The Council of the ORG dismissed the application at the end of its sitting on DATE , holding that H had not established that there were exceptional circumstances ; in particular , the consequences of disbarment did not constitute such circumstances . In response to the memorandum of CARDINAL DATE ( see paragraph CARDINAL above ) , it stated that the relevant procureur général was aware of the facts before the decision was given and had ordered a judicial investigation .
The decision was served on the applicant on DATE .
CARDINAL . ORG In GPE the councils of the ORG have exclusive jurisdiction to decide on applications for restoration to the roll .
CARDINAL . ORG For each of ORG , together with the bâtonnier and the general assembly , is an administrative organ of the profession of avocat .

CARDINAL . ORG It consists of the bâtonnier and from CARDINAL other members , according to the number of avocats on the Bar roll and the list of pupil avocats ; ORG has CARDINAL members in addition to the bâtonnier .
The members are directly elected by the general assembly of the ORG , to which all avocats on the roll are convened ( LAW ) ; the election is held before the end of each judicial year .

CARDINAL . ORG The ORG exercises numerous functions of an administrative , regulatory , adjudicative , advisory and disciplinary nature . In the instant case it is sufficient to mention the following .

CARDINAL . ORG Under LAW , which enshrines the case - law of ORG on the subject ( judgment of DATE , PERSON , I , p. CARDINAL ) , the ORG draws up the roll of avocats and the list of pupil avocats , and no appeal lies from its decisions in this matter . The principle of the ORG ’s having responsibility for its roll is justified by the need to restrict access to the profession to persons of unimpeachable integrity .

CARDINAL . It is also the ORG ’s duty to " protect the honour of the Ordre " and to " maintain the principles of dignity , probity and scrupulousness on which the profession is founded " ( Article CARDINAL ) .

CARDINAL . ORG As a disciplinary body , it punishes " offences and misconduct " ( ibid . ) . It will hear such cases " on an application by the bâtonnier , either of his own motion or following a complaint or after receipt of a written accusation from the procureur général " ( LAW .

The avocat concerned is summoned within DATE by registered letter and , if he so requests , is granted time to prepare his defence ( LAW ) . Within DATE of the decision ’s being given , it is notified by registered post to the procureur général and the avocat concerned ( Article CARDINAL ) .

The main penalties which the ORG may impose are warning , censure , reprimand , suspension for not DATE and striking off the roll or the list of pupil avocats ( FAC ) . The avocat concerned has a right both of objection ( opposition ) ( Article CARDINAL ) and , like the procureur général , of appeal ( appel ) ( Article CARDINAL ) . At the time the events in this case occurred ( see paragraph CARDINAL above ) , appeal lay to ORG ( LAW of DATE regulating the practice of the profession of avocat and the discipline of the Bar ) . DATE , this jurisdiction is exercised by disciplinary appeals boards , consisting of the President of ORG , who presides , and CARDINAL avocats sitting as assessors ( LAW ) .

Decisions of the courts of appeal in such matters could be appealed against on points of law ( section CARDINAL ) of LAW of DATE ) . The same now applies to decisions of the disciplinary appeals boards ( Article CARDINAL § CARDINAL of the Judicial Code ) .
CARDINAL . ORG Restoration to the roll of an avocat who has been struck off it is governed by LAW :

" No avocat who has been disbarred may be entered on a roll of the ORG or on a list of pupil avocats until DATE have elapsed from the date on which the decision to strike off became final and unless exceptional circumstances warrant it .

No such entry shall be permitted without the reasoned consent of ORG to which the avocat belonged or , as the case may be , the leave of the relevant disciplinary appeal authority if the disbarment was ordered by it .
No appeal shall lie against a refusal to restore to the roll . "
This text reproduces with minor variations LAW adopted on CARDINAL DATE by ORG . That resolution went some way towards removing the finality of disbarment and read as follows :
" ORG may ... , on his application , restore to the roll an avocat who has been struck off .

This measure , which is of an exceptional nature and lies wholly within the discretion of ORG , regard being had to the higher interests of the Bar and to whether reformation of the person concerned is clearly established , shall be permissible only after DATE have elapsed from the time when the disbarment penalty became final .
The ORG shall take its decision in accordance with the procedure provided for in Rule CARDINAL of LAW , as in the case of the admission of a pupil avocat . ... "

CARDINAL . ORG Although LAW is the last provision in Book III ( " The Bar " ) , Section I ( " General provisions " ) , LAW ( " Disciplinary matters " ) , the ORG does not use the disciplinary procedure ( LAW ) when dealing with an application for restoration to the roll ; nor is its decision a disciplinary one ( PERSON . DATE , Pasicrisie DATE , I , p. CARDINAL ) . The general law does not make any specific provisions ; and ORG did not have any internal rules of procedure at the relevant time . The ORG normally takes its decision in the same way and following the same procedure as on an application for admission .

CARDINAL . ORG According to figures provided by the Government ( and which were not disputed ) , CARDINAL avocats have been struck off in GPE since the Judicial Code came into force on DATE . Of the CARDINAL applications for restoration to the roll made by avocats who have been struck off , CARDINAL have been successful ( NORP , PERSON and ORG ) . ORG has had to deal only with H ’s applications , which were unsuccessful . None of the decisions in question is available to the public .
